OpenCV_to_RAPID.py¶

create_robtarget(gripper_height, gripper_rot, cam_pos, image, puck, cam_comp=False)¶

Complete a series of transformations to finally create a robtarget of the puck’s position from an image. These transformations are based on the setup at the University of Stavanger, and with a specific RobotStudio setup (in regards to coordinate systems). This Pack and Go file includes this setup.

Parameters

  • gripper_height (float) – Height of gripper above work object

  • gripper_rot (tuple) – Orientation of gripper, must be a Quaternion (tuple of length 4)

  • cam_pos (float[]) – Camera position [x,y]

  • image (ndarray) – An image

  • puck (Puck) – A Puck object

  • cam_comp (bool) – Running camera_adjustment?

Returns

A Puck object with robtarget as position

transform_position(gripper_rot, puck)¶

Transform coordinate system given by image in OpenCV to coordinate system of work object in RAPID. Swap x & y coordinates and rotate by the same amount that the camera has been rotated.

Parameters

  • gripper_rot (tuple) – Orientation of gripper, must be a Quaternion (tuple of length 4)

  • puck (Puck) – A Puck object

pixel_to_mm(gripper_height, puck, image)¶

Converts coordinates in image from pixels to millimeters. This depends on the camera’s working distance.

Parameters

  • gripper_height (float) – Height of gripper above work object

  • puck (Puck) – A Puck object

  • image (ndarray) – An image

overshoot_comp(gripper_height, puck)¶

Compensate for the overshoot phenomenon which occurs when trying to pinpoint the location of a 3D object in a 2D image.

Parameters

  • gripper_height (float) – Height of gripper above work object

  • puck (Puck) – A Puck object

camera_compensation(gripper_height, gripper_rot, puck)¶

Compensate for an angled camera view. Different cameras will be angled differently both internally and externally when mounted to a surface. The slope values must first be calculated by running camera_adjustment. Works with any camera orientation.

Parameters

  • gripper_height (float) – Height of gripper above work object

  • gripper_rot (tuple) – Orientation of gripper, must be a Quaternion (tuple of length 4)

  • puck (Puck) – A Puck object

get_camera_position(trans, rot)¶

Uses the offset between the gripper and camera to find the camera’s position. `Robot Web Services`_

Parameters

  • trans (float[]) – Position of gripper

  • rot (tuple) – Orientation of gripper, must be a Quaternion (tuple of length 4)

Returns

Position of camera
